description: Variational quantum model that learns probability distributions over financial features for regime detection and scenario generation. Uses quantum circuits to represent Boltzmann energy landscape, enabling expressive latent representations.
use_cases: Scenario generation for VaR/CVaR stress testing

backend_config.description: Simulator or hardware details (shots, noise model)

training_params.description: Learning rate, epochs, batch size, optimizer

generated_samples.description: Synthetic feature samples drawn from QBM

metrics.description: Log-likelihood, KL divergence vs historical data

algorithm_steps: Preprocess and normalize data; reduce dimension to qubit budget
Define QBM Hamiltonian and variational circuit
Train parameters via gradient descent using estimator measurements
Generate samples or regime probabilities for downstream modules

pseudocode.snippet:
energy = estimator.run(qc, observable=ising_hamiltonian).result().values[0]
params = params - lr * grad_energy

advantages: Expressive latent modeling via quantum correlations
Natural fit for regime detection and scenario generation
limitations: Limited by qubit counts and noise
Difficult to scale beyond small feature sets today

integration_points.rl_sandbox: Augments training data with QBM samples
